title: Pull Request
description: Pull requests let you tell others about changes you've pushed to a repository on GitHub. Once a pull request is sent, interested parties can review the set of changes, discuss potential modifications, and even push follow-up commits if necessary.

base.description: The name of the branch you want your changes pulled into. This should be an existing branch on the current repository. You cannot update the base branch on a pull request to point to another repository.

title.description: The title of the pull request.

maintainer_can_modify.description: Indicates whether maintainers can modify the pull request.

draft.description: Indicates whether or not the pull request is a draft.

body.description: The contents of the pull request.

head.description: The name of the branch where your changes are implemented. For cross-repository pull requests in the same network, namespace `head` with a user like this: `username:branch`.

legacy_body.description: The contents of the pull request.

issue.description: The issue number in this repository to turn into a Pull Request.

number.description: Number uniquely identifying the pull request within its repository.

state.description: State of this Pull Request. Either `open` or `closed`.

pull_number.description: The number of the pull request.

commit_title.description: Commit message title to use for the merge commit; if omitted, a default message will be used

commit_message.description: Commit message to use for the merge commit; if omitted, a default message will be used

sha.description: SHA that pull request head must match to allow merge; if omitted, no check is performed

merge_method.description: The merge method to use. If omitted, defaults to 'merge'

update_method.description: The update branch method to use. If omitted, defaults to 'merge'

squash.description: If true, commit a single commit to the head branch. If false or omitted, use a merge commit.

links.title: Update branch on a pull request with latest HEAD from upstream

expected_head_sha.description: SHA that the pull request head ref must match to allow merge. If not submitted, defaults to the sha of the current head ref.

visibility.description: The repository visibility: public, private, or internal.
The repository visibility: public, private, or internal.
